bayes

Class BayesianNetwork

  • java.lang.Object
    • bayes.BayesianNetwork

  • public class BayesianNetwork
extends java.lang.Object
    Objects of this class encapsulate a complete Bayesian Network.
    Author:
    Matthew Bernstein - matthewb@cs.wisc.edu

      • isValidEdge

        public java.lang.Boolean isValidEdge(BNNode parent,
                            BNNode child)

        Parameters:

        child - the child
        Returns:

      • isValidReverseEdge

        public java.lang.Boolean isValidReverseEdge(BNNode parent,
                                   BNNode child)
        Determines if reversing the edge from (parent -> child) will result in a valid DAG. If the original edge (parent -> child) doesn't exists, then this method simply is testing whether adding (child -> parent) is valid.
        Parameters:
        parent - the parent node
        child - the child node
        Returns:
        true if reversing the edge will not result in a cycle, false otherwise

      • queryConditionalProbability

        public java.lang.Double queryConditionalProbability(BNConditionalQuery query)
        Query for a conditional probability in the Bayes net. This method returns the probability for the value of a specific attribute in the network conditioned on a set of values for other variables in the network. For example, this method is used for calculated probabilities of the form P(A = a | E = e, D = d).
        Parameters:
        query -
        Returns:

      • queryJointProbability

        public java.lang.Double queryJointProbability(BNJointQuery query)
        Query for a joint probability in the bayes net. This method computes a probability of the form P(A = a, E = e, D = d).
        Parameters:
        query - the joint probability query
        Returns:
        the resulting probability

      • runEnumeration

        private java.lang.Double runEnumeration(java.util.ArrayList<pair.Pair<Attribute,java.lang.Integer>> currValues,
                              java.util.ArrayList<BNNode> toIterate)
        A recursive algorithm that runs the inference by enumeration to get the joint probability of a query.

        For example, if we have a network with the following adjacency-list:

        B -> A C -> A C -> D

        And we wish to query P(A = a, D = d), the enumeration we must perform is:
        Σ b ∈ B Σ c ∈ C P(A = a | B = b) * P(B = b) * P(A = a | C = c) * P(C = c) * P(D = d | C = d)
        Parameters:
        currValues - a list of attribute/value pairs that have already been assigned in the current enumeration
        toIterate - a list of nodes for which we still need to enumerate over their values
        Returns:
        return the joint probability result of the enumeration

      • calculateProbability

        private java.lang.Double calculateProbability(java.util.ArrayList<pair.Pair<Attribute,java.lang.Integer>> values)
        Calculate a single term in the enumeration
        Parameters:
        values - attribute/value pairs in the term of the enumeration
        Returns:
        the resulting term

      • buildCPDQuery

        private CPDQuery buildCPDQuery(BNNode node,
                     java.lang.Integer nodeValue,
                     java.util.ArrayList<pair.Pair<Attribute,java.lang.Integer>> queryDetails)
        Given a node and a set of attribute/value pairs, this method constructs the proper CPDQuery object where the query object queries for a conditional probability of the target node given as assignemtn of this node's parents
        Parameters:
        node - the target node
        queryDetails - a list of attribute/value pairs
        Returns:
        a query object querying for the conditional probability on the target node given an assignment of its parents variables.

      • getNodesAbove

        public java.util.Set<BNNode> getNodesAbove(BNNode node)
        Gets all nodes above a certain node in the network DAG structure including the node itself.

        Example: if we have a network with the following adjacency-list:

        A -> B
        D -> A
        E -> A


        This method would return B,A,E,D for node B.
        This method would return A,E,D for node A.
        Parameters:
        node - the query node
        Returns:
        all nodes above the query node in the DAG structure of the net

      • getNumEdges

        public java.lang.Integer getNumEdges()
        Returns:
        the number of edges in the network

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        an artificial data set

      • getNetInferenceName

        public java.lang.String getNetInferenceName()
        Returns:

      • setInference

        Parameters:
        netInference - the algorithm used to create the network's structure

      • separateSpecifiedUnspecified

        private pair.Pair<java.util.ArrayList<BNNode>,java.util.ArrayList<BNNode>> separateSpecifiedUnspecified(java.util.Collection<BNNode> nodes,
                                                                                              BNJointQuery query)
        A helper method for separating a set of nodes into two partitions based on a joint probability query. Say we have a query (A = a, B = b), both of these nodes may form the total set of nodes (A, B, C, D, E) that must be considered in the probability calculation. This method separates (A, B, C, D, E) -> (A, B) + (C, D, E) the nodes specified in the query and the nodes not specified in the query but must be considered.
        Parameters:
        nodes - all nodes considered in the probability calculation
        query - the query for the probability
        Returns:
        the partition of all nodes to be considered into a list of nodes specified in the query (first element) and those that are not specified (second element).
